page.title: 10FYLDE AGRICULTURE.
page.content: The main use of the land is Pastoral.There are two main farms within the area of study,Brook Farm consisting of 77 acres on which Dairy farming and replacement farming take place. Little Carrside Farm consisting of 85 acres dates back to the 17th. Century. Dairy Farming is the main farming type.The only crop grown is grass for silage,which is used to feed the cattle.Because the land is low-lying it is affected by the tide but this only affects 10 of the 85 acres. The busiest times of the year are between May and December.The Guardian farms have some electric fencing.They employ 22 people,their busiest time is between September to October.The Guardian has owned the farm since 1963.
